General information.Content: This database contains data from international key comparisons for radionuclide metrology since the inception of the international system of reference (SIR) for radionuclide metrology at the BIPM in 1976.
General information.Note: This version of the machine-readable comparison report is not definitive. The format is under discussion within the CCRI and CIPM to best reflect the requirements of ionizing radiation metrology and to conform to the SI digital framework. Users can use this document to analyse key comparison data and metadata more efficiently with their software. However, users should bear in mind that the format will necessarily evolve in subsequent updates of this key comparison, which will not guarantee the long-term compatibility of their interface.

References.[1]: Romain Coulon et al 2022 Meas. Sci. Technol. 33 024003 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/ac3fc4
References.[2]: Romain Coulon et al 2023 Meas. Sci. Technol. 34 074009 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/accd0b

Data from POLATOM-2023.Contributor(s) from the laboratory: Justyna Marganiec-Ga\k{l}\k{a}zka, Tomasz Ziemek, Zbigniew Tymi\'{n}ski, Edyta Lech
Data from POLATOM-2023.Reference for the decay data used by the: Chechev V.P., Kuzmenko N.K., \href{http://www.lnhb.fr/nuclides/Mn-54_tables.pdf}{\textit{LNE - LNHB/CEA Table de Radionucl\'eides}, June 2014, Vol. 1}
Data from POLATOM-2023.Comments on the equivalent activity: The weighted average of the three methods evaluated by POLATOM, 416.2(22) kBq, was used to calculate an equivalent activity equal to 19~660(110) kBq. This result deviates from the KCRV by around 2~\%.
Data from POLATOM-2023.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: National Centre for Nuclear Research Radioisotope Centre POLATOM

Data from POLATOM-2024.Comment(s) on the measurement method(s): measurement system (called 4$\pi$) using the 4$\pi$(LS)-gamma coincidence method, measurement system (called 4$\pi$) using the 4$\pi$(LS)-gamma anticoincidence method, measurement system (called TDKG) using the 4$\pi$(LS)-gamma coincidence method
Data from POLATOM-2024.Reference for the decay data used by the: Chechev V.P., Kuzmenko N.K., \href{http://www.lnhb.fr/nuclides/Mn-54_tables.pdf}{\textit{LNE - LNHB/CEA Table de Radionucl\'eides}, June 2014, Vol. 1}
Data from POLATOM-2024.Comments on the equivalent activity: The weighted average of the three methods evaluated by POLATOM, 1702.3(126) kBq, was used to calculate the equivalent activity for the KCDB. The final measurement uncertainty of 12.6 kBq was determined as the systematic uncertainty of the mean.
